docs.snippet: LEAD: Elliott Abrams, the Reagan Administration's point man on aid to the Nicaraguan rebels, does not want to talk about that subject these days.

headline.main: New Abrams Posture on Contra Aid

docs.snippet: LEAD: The presidents of Mexico and Brazil, Latin America's two biggest debtor nations, are to meet here this week to discuss the region's continuing economic crisis.
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The presidents of Mexico and Brazil, Latin America's two biggest debtor nations, are to meet here this week to discuss the region's continuing economic crisis.

headline.main: Heads of Brazil, Mexico To Discuss Debt Crisis

docs.snippet: LEAD: After watching his team muddle through the first 20 minutes of practice Saturday, Denny Crum, the normally mild-mannered coach from Louisville and the coach of the United States men's basketball team at the Pan American Games, lost his cool.

byline.original: By WILLIAM C. RHODEN, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: When the United States and Cuba complete the boxing confrontation at the Pan American Games, the tabulations of medals won or lost may not provide as accurate an appraisal as the words of Patrick Byrd.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Eight Latin American nations agreed today to play a direct role in insuring that the new regional peace treaty is carried out to the letter.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Two men described by the police as members of the Colombo organized-crime family were slain in Brooklyn yesterday by one or two gunmen who strode up to them on a quiet sidewalk, opened fire, leaped into a car driven by an accomplice and sped...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Two men described by the police as members of the Colombo organized-crime family were slain in Brooklyn yesterday by one or two gunmen who strode up to them on a quiet sidewalk, opened fire, leaped into a car driven by an accomplice and sped away.

headline.main: 2 Mob Figures Slain by Gunman in Brooklyn

docs.snippet: LEAD: THE struggle over this year's trade legislation, which goes into a penultimate phase this week, is part of the long tug-of-war between the legislative and executive branches over who is to make foreign policy.

headline.main: Congress Is Preparing To Seize the Historical Moment in Trade Law
